title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The issue is with the line in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil which uses Class.forName() syntax to load the BidiUtil class. However, this usage of reflection causes a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT. Although this issue may not be apparent when using the eclipse compiler or Sun's compiler, it poses a problem when verifying or using jxeLink. The aim is to remove the reflection in order to resolve the issue.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Use the CLDC version of SWT.
2. Verify or use jxeLink.
3. Observe the NoClassDefFoundError due to the usage of Class.forName() in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil.
4. Perform the necessary changes to remove the reflection in BidiUtil.
